programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: While investigating a bank robbery, Sue and the team discover it was robbed five years ago - has the robber returned to the scene of the crime? The clue trail leads them to a surprising twist.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue is offered an exciting new high-profile job at the FBI - but is torn when she realizes it means leaving her FBI teammates and friends, including twelve-year-old Amanda, behind.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Izzy asks Bull to petition the court to have her best friend's body exhumed when the woman's son alleges she was murdered, despite her death already ruled accidental.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Flashbacks reveal Bull's attempt to get a new trial for a wrongly convicted prisoner that inspired him to work in trial science 12 years earlier.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull and the team worry about jury bias when Bull mounts a murder trial defense for a Black Lives Matter activist.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull is hired to help a woman determined to go against legal advice when she insists on pleading guilty to the murder of a wealthy philanthropist who preyed on her as a teenager.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Chunk does his daughter a favor and convinces Bull to represent a teenager who is on trial for robbery and refuses to name his accomplice; Chunk is suspicious of Anna's boyfriend; Taylor struggles when the trial has her working around the clock.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: During a bank run for his off-duty security job, Halstead and his co-workers are attacked by a violent robbery crew, which leads to a shootout; Voight and Lindsay talk to a dispensary owner who says her business has received threats from local gangs.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The team discovers a secret battered woman's shelter and learns the owner has been wounded and a resident has been abducted; Burgess and Roman track down a man who has been catfishing people on a dating app to rob them.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When Burgess and Lindsay respond to a call about a stabbing, the assailant turns out to be a kidnapping victim escaping her captor; Ruzek accuses Roman of having feelings for Burgess.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: After a cold and unmoving newborn baby is discovered in a duffel bag on a Chicago lakefront, Chicago Med is able to provide information that helps zero in on a suspect; Roman and Burgess grow closer.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When a man opens fire on a patrol car and wounds Roman, Burgess pursues the shooter; with no gun found at the scene, Burgess faces the accusation of shooting an unarmed man; the man who sent Voight to prison is assigned to help defend Burgess.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Lindsay and Halstead discover the youngest daughter is the only survivor of a shooting at a family home; Antonio and Olinsky investigate a pyramid scheme self-help group; Platt tries to convince Crowley that Burgess and Roman should remain partners.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When the body of a single mother is found in the trunk of her car, the team is shocked to learn the victim had contact with Voight's reformed son.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Burgess fights for her life as the team scrambles to find her kidnapper; Dep. Supt. Sam Miller is desperate to find her son's killer; Voight and Upton deal with the aftermath of their decision; Ruzek struggles with the pressure of the situation.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When a P.D. informant is murdered, the team digs in to track down the perpetrator only to learn a shocking truth; Voight and Ruzek strategize to help Burgess.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Halstead's past resurfaces when a former Army colleague is implicated in a deadly blast; as the FBI launches an investigation into Roy's disappearance, Upton feels the pressure of the secret she and Voight are sharing.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When Upton and Ruzek answer an emergency call to an abandoned house, their investigation leads them down a dark path.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: As the team works to solve a deadly shooting in Burnside, Atwater realizes he has a very personal connection to the case.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Ruzek reunites with an old colleague to take down a crime ring, but when things don't add up, Voight and Burgess do some investigating of their own.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: As the team works to bring down a drug ring, Voight builds trust with a new informant; however, it soon becomes clear she has a plan of her own.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: As the team investigates the stabbing of a father with two young daughters, they begin to suspect there is more to the story than meets the eye; the FBI investigation into Roy Walton's death intensifies while Voight, Upton and Halstead feel the heat.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: With the FBI closing in on the Roy Walton investigation, Voight and Halstead strategize a way out; after a city bus driver is shot by a passenger, the team investigates a possible abduction.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Maya Ricci's boyfriend Tony is something of a mystery man who tends to come and go without much explanation. When he surprises Maya for a visit, his disappearance the following morning is caused by more sinister circumstances. When his car is discovered in the debris of an explosion and a mysterious strangers starts asking about Maya, Hammer and his team take up the investigation. They uncover a connection between Tony and the CIA, and other more nefarious entities. Mike decides to protect Maya at any costs before it is too late.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: It's a rough night at the table for Mike and some of his buddies on poker night. A wild card named Angel thinks he's getting hustled and tries his luck by pulling a gun on Hammer. After the last hand, the night turns to threats, theft, and even murder. Mike looks for suspects and an alibi while Barry Lawrence harasses him, Skip Gleason, and his other friends with a new scorched-earth policy against gambling.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Lila B. has earned Mike Hammer's attention for a number of reasons, not least of which is her intoxicating voice. But the beautiful jazz singer also has a dangerous side, keeping company with mobsters. When her beaux arrested, he's forced rat on his partners. The plot thickens when one of Lila's gentlemen called is killed and she becomes a suspect. With both the police and the mob on her heels, Hammer is determined to keep the songstress safe.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A case involving the murder of a drug dealer turns personal for Special Agent Sam Hanna when he discovers his former Navy Seal comrades are involved.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team is assigned to track down a missing unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) after it is compromised during a training exercise, killing a Marine before it disappears.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: When an Iraqi businessman is murdered, the team searches for the former Marine who was hired to protect him.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Following a murder, the secrets to classified software are thought to be lost until NCIS uncovers a suspect from Vance's past.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The NCIS team must find a motive when they discover the body of a Marine who had been living a double life as a wealthy bachelor.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Carver deals with the fallout of his arrest; Brett searches for closure with the baby she rescued; Capp weasels his way into the Firehouse 51 group chat.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Brett waits for life-changing news; Herrmann encounters a psychic with a grave warning on a call; Kidd finds a new lead on the Homeland Security case.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Firehouse 51 is forced to share space with Firehouse 17; Kidd and Herrmann fight over Ritter; an arson case tests Kidd and Severide's relationship; Firehouse 51 says goodbye to one of its own.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Mouch sets out to change his legacy and nickname; Ritter pushes Herrmann to see a doctor; Brett searches for the perfect wedding venue.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: After witnessing a domestic dispute, Brett and Violet decide to take the investigation into their own hands; Mouch vets Truck 81's new firefighter; Herrmann relies on something new to aid him on the job.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Julia spends a couple of days at 51; Boden's stepson, James, returns, desperate for Boden to help his mother; after a little girl starts a fire in her backyard, Kidd and her team decide to dig deeper.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: After their defibrillator malfunctions on a call, Brett and Violet search for answers; Herrmann tries to find the perfect home for his new recliner; a secret from Gibson's past comes to light.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Firehouse 51 welcomes back some familiar faces and says goodbye to Brett; Violet scrambles to decorate Brett's wedding venue; a call at the expo center takes a shocking turn.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Violet clashes with her new partner; Severide discovers a hidden stash of money on a call and squares off against the cops working the case; Mouch gets a parking ticket.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes capped a big day with 291 yards passing and three touchdowns on a gimpy ankle. Mahomes went 5 for 5 on the only drive of overtime. programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.desc: In a historic and first ever trip to Connecticut's Mohegan Sun Casino, Natalie Gage vs. Sarah Click, Rick Hawn vs. Stephen Stengel, Mike Trizano vs. Louie Lopez and Jimmie Rivera vs. Daniel Straus make an outstanding account for BKFC talent.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: A stacked fight card in Omaha features some heavy hitters in intriguing matchups! Watch BRAUN vs MCINTOSH, GROSU vs MARTINEZ,COCHRANE vs HOLLOWAY &TRINIDAD-SNAKE vs PAGUE as they battle during a Fight Night.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In three epic clashes, JOSH KREJCI welcomes NATE MORROW to the Squared Circle,TOMMY STRYDOM takes on COREY ROBERTS and BOBBY TAYLOR goes to war with RYAN ROBERTS. Don't miss these incredible showings of toughness from Omaha!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Prospects throw down in a handful of first-time showings in Denver with RAMIRO FIGUEROA vs BRETT HUDSON and JOSH HUBER vs ANDREW YATES. Also, in BKFC veteran matchups, CRISTINA CRIST, CASSIE ROBB, SAWYER DEPEE and KEEGAN VANDERMEER match up.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Knuckle Up returns with heavy-hitting action as HASAN YOUSEFI clashes with knockout artist GUTO INOCENTE, AARON CHALMERS steps in against CHAS SYMONDS in a heated showdown, and NICOLAS GAFFIE faces the relentless BRANDON ALLEN.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Watch some serious showings of toughness and skill asJOSEPH CREER vs DANIEL MITCHELL,ZEB VINCENT vs CASEY MOSES,DERRICK FINDLEY vs SERGIO LOPEZ &DYLAN SCHULTE vs ROBERTO ARMAS lay it all on the line in Denver.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Three titles are on the line in Hollywood, Florida with WARREN vs ESCOBOZA fighting for light heavyweight gold, BLAS vsRICHARDSON battling at bantamweight and bad blood boils over as BRYAN DURAN comes for KAI STEWART'S featherweight strap!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In a showcase of incredible bare-knuckle matchmaking,LEONARDO PERDOMO vs LEO BERCIER,GEE PEREZ vs ALBERT INCLAN,CHRISTINE VICENS vs MELANIE SHAH &JUSTIN IBARROLA vs RICK CARUSO demonstrate the grittiness of BKFC.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In four tough-fought wars, we see none of these bouts go the distance! Watch BKFC talent battle with SIMPSON vs SUAREZ,ZUCKERMAN vs CEDENO,PLAZAOLA vs DODSON &GARCIA vs LIVINGSTON at BKFC 62.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Milton Keynes is one of several European homes for the BKFC and for good reason. The city never disappoints and the fighters throw down.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.desc: Becky introduces Tyler to Beverly Rose, but she is skeptical of Tyler’s approach.

programme.desc: Mark adjusts to his first day of college as a commuter student.

programme.desc: Darlene crashes Mark’s college trivia night to prove how smart she is.

programme.desc: Darlene urges Ben to make some male friends as he feels anxious about turning 50.

programme.desc: Darlene seeks to be manager of food services at Mark’s college after feeling they could use some organization.

programme.desc: Dan is asked to write an article for a Hardware magazine, making Ben miss his days as a writer.

programme.desc: A fire at Ben’s hardware store causes a major setback for the family.

programme.desc: Dan achieves a major financial milestone, reconsidering his belief in the ‘Conners curse.’

programme.desc: Mark takes on odd jobs, determined to find a way to pay for school.

programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team celebrate the bounty our gardens have to offer at this time of year as Carol Klein gathers wild blackberries, Monty Don is at Longmeadow, and we join a champion vegetable grower in Yorkshire as he prepares for the biggest show of the season.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Nick Bailey celebrate gardeners throughout the country who have created some truly unique gardens and made every space count. Carol meets a couple in Dorset whose garden is full of inspirational features.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes a special guest, the Duchess of Cornwall, to Longmeadow, where she shares her love of gardening. Nick Bailey visits Knoll Gardens and gives his tips on the tall perennials which give a burst of colour towards the end of the season.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow, enjoying the colours of late summer in the garden. Adam Frost, Carol Klein and Frances Tophill get an exclusive preview of Gardeners' World Live at the NEC.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow with plenty of seasonal advice to keep gardens colourful. Will Young shows off his south London courtyard garden and reveals why it has become an absolute joy in his life, and Joe Swift helps him create some seasonal pot displays for sunny and shady spots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets some shrubs in the ground and plans ahead for spring with some bulb planting. Meanwhile, Frances Tophill joins Sue Kent on her allotment to find out how her growing year has been.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join Adam in his garden for a seasonal catch-up. Toby Buckland gives timely tips on summer and autumn maintenance for borders, plus join singer-songwriter Billie Marten as she shares her passion for growing vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team celebrate the wonder of trees and explore the vital role they play in gardens and the wider landscape. Zoe Ball joins Toby Buckland on a visit to a tree project in North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his spuds and sows seeds for autumn veg. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond celebrate the horticultural genius of William Robinson in the gardens of his former home, Gravetye Manor in Sussex. Fresh off the back of her success at Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival, Sue Kent gives her own garden some TLC and creates a special container display using small pots. There's also a passionate grower in London who uses every available space in his garden to grow a vast range of vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's dividing his Pulmonaria and gives advice on frost-protection, Joe visits a tropical oasis outside Bristol, and Carol looks at Rowans from around the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: The King of Cedar Key, Capt. Jimbo Keith ⎮ Episode #867On Today’s Podcast, I have a very special guest, He is known as the King of Cedar Key, Captain Jimbo Keith. Nearly 40 years ago, Jimbo’s father, Jimbo Sr, founded Saltwater Assassin, the premiere charter fishing company in Cedar Key. Working at the same company, Jimbo heads an airboat through the shallow waters of Northern Florida. Join us in learning about the beautiful Old Florida, and what it is like captaining 270 days out of the year. programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Join Captain Danny Allen and Dan Benson from Power-Pole as they embark on an exciting fishing expedition in Cortez, Florida, in the latest installment of Beyond The Surface TV. programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of Team Winchester shooters Zach Kienbaum and Desirae Edmunds is told. Zach and Desi discuss how they got started in the shooting sports and how important coaching has become to both of them. They also talk shooting tips. Theo Ribbs breaks down the shotgun sports while Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Paul Sawyer, Nikki Boxler and Gabe Adair have a friendly sporting clays competition.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The Pacific Northwest does not have the easiest conditions to train in for this shooting sports team. For this Seattle-based SST Ravens, this skeet and trap team finds that the challenging weather they train in comes in handy when competing. Also: Competition shooting tips form pro shooter Theo Ribbs.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every spring brings a new opportunity to take a step forward & recall the memories of seasons past. World War II Veteran and retired Judge Arden Hill has spent most of his life chasing turkeys in the hills of Tennessee. Now in his 90’s, Arden doesn’t let age stand in the way of his love for spring turkey hunting. Also: patterning turkey shotguns and hunting spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Winchester introduces the Shoot United brand aimed at offering useful information and tips to the millions of new shooters entering the shooting sports. New York native and Midland University competitive shotgun shooter Amy Cawley and her journey as a student-athlete is followed. Also: Theo Ribbs gives shooting tips for competition and Foster Bartholow reviews Winchester AA Diamond Grade.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisiana’s rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: Life On The Water

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon explores the sunken vessels and beautiful waters of the Florida Panhandle with local guide, Brady Hale.

programme.title: Life On The Water

programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When overnight temps go low and the tides go lower, it forces Redfish to move. Justin & Travis break out a new micro skiff to see how low they can go to ambush shifting redfish on the flats.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s playtime for Travis & Justin when offshore guide Josh Sauls shares a secret honey hole and his fishing ancestry. Then luck shines when the guys find another sweet spot on the way back.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: The irresistibly serene gulf waters off Panama City Beach lure Justin into taking Capt. Ed Zyak out to see what's biting. It quickly turns into a study session and a lesson. Patience + perseverance = success.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin has spent a lifetime buying, selling and rigging boats to fit his angling needs. Learn what you need to ask yourself before shopping for the perfect boat and what to look for at the dealership.

programme.desc: Legendary Pro Skateboarders Mike McGill and Bucky Lasek of the Bones Brigade join Nick for high-flying dorado action off SoCal and Mexico

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Jersey Shipwrecks hold beastly blackfish as Nick hops aboard with three top blackfish captains to target trophy tautog using jigs and secret methods.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Early winter in Key West means wahoo is on everyone’s mind and Ali and Rush are ready to put in the lures and the time to get it done. Once the conditions line up it’s time to go all in, wahoo or bust.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Fish tacos are about as SoCal as it gets and on this visit to San Diego, Ali takes Rush fishing on a rockfish and lobster "grocery run". Slow pitch jigging and hoop netting are the techniques of choice and the rewards are delicious.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Guatemala to fish with David Salazar at Casa Vieja Lodge aboard the latest addition to the fleet. If this boat could talk, the tales of record breaking fish and world travels would be endless and Dave’s big plans for it are sure to make for an exciting new chapter.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The boys are back in the Florida Keys fishing with Capt. Tony Murphy from the Saltwater Angler tackle shop in Key West aboard his 32’ SeaVee. Tony takes the boys into the Gulf of Mexico to chase Permit on wrecks using live crabs for bait. The Gulf doesn’t disappoint and also provides plenty of action from other Florida Keys species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With slow pitch jigging being the newest craze, Rush and buddy Dane head out to test some new tackle and go for “mutton or nothing.” Meanwhile in California, Ali gets his hand on the new gear and prepares to hop a flight and join in on the “slow pitch” party with the guys in Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When the weather in San Diego throws the crew a curveball, Ali, Rush and friend Brandon Nelson put together plan B. Targeting Yellowtail and Mako sharks, the guys search for kelp paddies on the horizon and look to friend at the fish house for some “shark attractant” to make it all come together.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell brings some game changing technology along as he joins Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor for some nighttime tarpon fishing at the Long Key Bridge.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Sam Milazzo to find the elusive daytime Swordfish but run into some great Dolphin fishing on the way.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: "Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor patiently pursue big tarpon from the Everglades to the Middle Keys with fly rod in hand."

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Richard Black for an exciting adventure in Key Largo, catching a wide variety of fish species on the shallow reef.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Jeff Malone to find a frenzy of exciting Bluefish near Marathon, FL.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Jeff Malone to find a productive wreck with which they enjoy the exciting variety of fish that wrecks can provide.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss travels to Melbourne, on Florida’s Space Coast, to cast flies with Capt. Noah Miler at some unforgettable fish.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the local Key West ship wrecks covered in Permit, Rush takes good friend and marine artist KC Scott fishing for "inspiration." While permit is the plan, the boys stay rigged and ready for the numerous species the Florida Keys may deliver when fishing offshore.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every spring brings a new opportunity to take a step forward & recall the memories of seasons past. programme.title: Winchester Life

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: It Had to Be You
programme.desc: Society girl Victoria Stafford (Ginger Rogers) garners a reputation for leaving men at the altar. Getting engaged for a fourth time, Victoria believes she's found the right man -- until on a train she has a strange dream about a Native American who claims that he is her true love. Awakening, Victoria is startled to find the dream man, George (Cornel Wilde), who claims to really exist, while also being a figment of her imagination. Back at home, George guides Victoria to a startling discovery.

programme.title: The Taming of the Shrew
programme.desc: A rich merchant's beautiful daughter and her volatile older sister are courted by rival suitors in this rambunctious version of Shakespeare's comedy.

programme.title: A Woman of Distinction

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton

programme.title: The Three Stooges in Orbit

programme.title: The Long Gray Line
programme.desc: An Irish immigrant who found a home in the Army as a West Point instructor becomes very close to his pupils, one of whom is Dwight Eisenhower.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: You Can't Run Away From It
programme.desc: A spoiled heiress teams up with an enterprising reporter to escape her domineering father's plan of keeping her from getting married.

programme.title: She Played With Fire
programme.desc: An English insurance man (Jack Hawkins) discovers his ex-girlfriend (Arlene Dahl) and her husband's (Dennis Price) art-forgery/arson scam.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: This steamy pot-boiler follows the intrigues surrounding an escaped convict who attempts to return to the small southern town where he grew up.

programme.title: Dead Reckoning
programme.desc: A war hero steps off a train and into a world of gambling, blackmail and murder while searching for a fellow vet who inexplicably disappeared himself.

programme.title: Scandal Sheet
programme.desc: After accidentally killing his ex-wife, an editor of a tabloid newspaper discovers that his ace reporters are investigating the story.

programme.title: Hamlet
programme.desc: The prince's quest for revenge becomes his undoing when his suspicion is confirmed that his uncle killed his father to win the throne and his mother.

programme.title: In the French Style
programme.desc: A young American travels to Paris to become an artist. Swept up in a series of affairs, she must decide whether to stay or return home to get married.

programme.title: Duffy

programme.title: The Whole Town's Talking
programme.desc: Clerk Arthur Jones (Edward G. Robinson) lives a dull life until someone realizes that he looks like gangster "Killer" Mannion (also Robinson). After Jones is brought in by the police and his identity is verified, he is given a note to assuage any other suspicious policeman. Jones is hired by a newspaper to write about Mannion and starts dating Wilhelmina Clark (Jean Arthur). However, when Jones returns home one night, Mannion is waiting and demands the note so that he can roam freely.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: Operation Mad Ball

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friend’s marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The victims must outsmart their cruel captors after an outlaw, and his gang kidnap an heiress, her nervous husband, and a rancher.

programme.title: The White Squaw

programme.title: Thunderhoof

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: Reprisal!
programme.desc: Frank Madden (Guy Madison), who is part Native American but passes as white, purchases a ranch in the small town of Kendall, Okla. When Frank moves in, he finds that the bigoted townspeople have recently let three brothers, who are also his neighbors, get away with the lynching murder of innocent Native Americans. As tensions between the townspeople and local Native Americans rise, Hank becomes torn between fighting against injustice and keeping his true identity a secret.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter crossing the Arizona desert routs a band of marauding Apaches and rescues the young survivor of a massacre.

programme.title: Apache Ambush
programme.desc: On a cattle drive to Kansas after the Civil War, an ex-Union soldier comes up against Apache and Confederate renegades.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: Wyoming Renegades
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Phil Carey) and his girlfriend (Martha Hyer) cannot start over until they stop Butch Cassidy's (Gene Evans) gang.

programme.title: Trail of the Rustlers
programme.desc: When a member of the villainous Mahoney family is slain while escaping the jail cell he'd been put in by Steve Armitage (Charles Starrett), aka the Durango Kid, the dead man's relatives vow to take down the Kid by any means necessary. Chick Mahoney (Don Harvey) poses as the Kid and tries to ruin the cowboy's reputation by stealing from nearby ranchers, but with the help of sidekick Smiley Burnette (Smiley Burnette), the Kid sets out to retrieve the stolen goods and repair his good name.

programme.title: Two Rode Together
programme.desc: For a fee, hard-drinking Texas marshal Guthrie McCabe (James Stewart) agrees to help Army officer Jim Gary (Richard Widmark) search for a group of whites who were abducted years earlier by Comanche warriors. After rescuing two of the abductees, McCabe and Gary find that the former captives have fully adopted the culture of their American Indian captors and are barely recognizable. Cultures collide as they attempt to return the settlers to their original -- and now long-forgotten -- lives.

programme.title: The Return of Daniel Boone
programme.desc: The scout's grandson (Bill Elliott) foils land-grabbers; his sidekick (Dub Taylor) flirts with twins.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Battle of Rogue River
programme.desc: A cavalry major (George Montgomery) makes peace with Indians despite an agitator (Richard Denning) working for carpetbaggers.

programme.title: Stage to Tucson
programme.desc: Trouble-shooters (Rod Cameron, Wayne Morris) track Arizona stagecoaches hijacked for sale to the Confederacy.

programme.title: The Hard Man
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fianceé, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: The Hawk of Wild River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) has himself thrown in jail to trick an outlaw known as the Hawk (Clayton Moore) and bring him and his entire gang to justice.

programme.title: Phantom Stagecoach
programme.desc: A dispute between stage lines ends with a steel-armored stagecoach.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Tom Thumb

programme.desc: A crack Nazi unit holds off the Allies during World War II.

programme.desc: Two brothers love the same woman at a perilous Indian outpost.

programme.title: The In-Laws (1979)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Routine disposal of drug evidence goes horribly wrong, leaving two police officers dead and the CSI team under investigation.

programme.title: CSI: Miami

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy pilot says she saw an unidentified object prior to a private plane crash; Pride suffers from insomnia and nightmares as a result of being kidnapped and drugged last year.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride travels to New York City after new DNA evidence is linked to a 20-year-old cold case from his past.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team uncovers a sinister plot by a private detention center contracted by the government to house undocumented immigrants; Lasalle and Sebastian travel to Alabama to search for Lasalle's missing brother.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Navy Lt. Max Landry asks the New Orleans field office for help when he suspects his girlfriend is a spy; Lasalle faces another devastating dead end as he searches for his brother's last known whereabouts.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Lasalle hopes to avenge his brother's murder by tracking a drug ring in Alabama he believes is responsible; when Pride assists with the case, he crosses paths with Eddie Barrett, an elusive individual who knows more than he is sharing.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Following a natural gas explosion at a movie theater, the team discovers the gas company has been hacked and more explosions could be triggered.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Sebastian calls the team to assist with a possible kidnapping case when a dignitary's son he was assigned to protect disappears from a local concert venue.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After Eddie Barrett provides an alibi witness, Pride and the team are more determined than ever to find a break in the case and avenge Lasalle's murder.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride is cut off from the team and backed into a corner after the investigation into Eddie Barrett uncovers a malicious plot.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team is concerned when Sebastian becomes unreachable while under cover as a new recruit.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team must track down a mysterious female assassin responsible for murders in Athens, Rome and London; Wade's son begs her to allow him to go on a police ride-along for an article he's writing on a youth outreach program.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a JAG captain who was discovered at home by his daughter, the only heir to his large estate; Sebastian is intimidated when he is put in charge of a team on his first day of training.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When Pride is unable to sleep due to continuing nightmares about the mysterious man in the red suit, he undergoes a specialized treatment to help him figure out the man's identity; an arrogant new officer joins the team.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Tammy must protect a teenage girl after her father is shot in their home; the rest of the team searches for a motive.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a man impersonating Lasalle attempts to free a young woman from jail, the team investigates both the impostor and the prisoner; Pride's daughter pays him a surprise visit.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Racial tensions rise in New Orleans when a white officer shoots a black Navy officer he believed was armed in the middle of a busy street party.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy sailor is found dead, the team tracks the suspicious movements of people in his life prior to his death; Hannah comes to terms with her daughter's relationship with her ex's new girlfriend.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When Sebastian is injured while unsuccessfully trying to prevent a kidnapping, NCIS races to find the missing woman and her abductors; the team gets a peek into Agent Carter's personal life.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Naval microbiologist whose hobby as a "myth buster" resulted in his death at the hands of a legendary bayou creature; Agent Khoury conducts an investigation into previous actions of Deputy Director Van Cleef.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Milton Cross, a feudal estate with a church, farms, houses and acres of land, depend on lord of the manor Edward Milton for their livelihoods. But when Sonia Woodley is stabbed in the churchyard two years after the death of her abusive husband Gerald, Barnaby and Jones investigate, trying to work out who killed her. It soon becomes clear someone took a pair of tailor scissors to do the deed, but who amongst the villagers could have done so, is unclear, and the investigation is complicated, when the pair learn the local Anglican priest, the parish vicar, had received a letter from Sonia. When he himself is killed, the pair believe something in the letter may be key to solving the mystery.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Sonia Woodley is stabbed two years after the death of her husband.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Dr. Ray Langston (Laurence Fishburne), from the Las Vegas office, comes to Miami when a severed leg found in the Everglades is linked to a girl who went missing in Las Vegas a week earlier.

programme.title: CSI: Miami

programme.title: CSI: Miami

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A bizarre case involving a man who was chopped in half baffles the CSIs; Natalia's injury puts her and Ryan in jeopardy.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSIs have 24 hours to determine if a man on death row is really guilty; Eric Delko returns to work on the case.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of an unpopular receptionist.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: After returning from war, Horatio's son seeks his help to solve a murder.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team splits up to investigate three different murders during spring break.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A murder victim's spirit won't leave Calleigh alone until she solves his case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Wealthy, eccentric and obese aristocrat Freddy Butler drops dead, shortly after gathering all three of his wives at Haddington Hall to make an announcement. Although George Bullard is adamant his death is from natural causes, the case is far from simple when Freddy's solicitor is deliberately killed in a house fire shortly afterwards and Freddy's will goes missing. Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating the extended Butler family, uncovering hidden secrets, illegitimate children and elusive treasure in the process.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Martin Barrett, a local council clerk living in Midsomer Worthy, is murdered during the night by shotgun, prompting Barnaby and Jones to find a motive for his murder. When they discover that Barrett was an expert blackmailer, his victims become prime suspects for his death - from a local pub landlord, a cleaner, a prominent member of the police board, to a former marine geologist. As they investigate, finding themselves drawn to the seaside, they slowly uncover deception, theft, attempted blackmail and hatred.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Broughton, a ninety-year-old battle of the sexes has often occurred, with men trying to oppose an event that the women have managed to successfully hold without interruption, until it culminates with casualties on both sides - Mildred Danvers, an elderly woman who had returned on the day of a funeral and poisoned in her hotel room, and Rev. Anthony Gant, shot during a major event being held in the village green, in view of many. It soon becomes clear someone may have wished to kill both to cover up a dark truth, and soon Barnaby has to figure out who amongst the village wanted both dead, complicated further when Gant's curate is murdered next.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers in Elverton-cum-Latterly are up in arms and divided, over the building of a supermarket. Things soon come to a head when independent environmental supervisor, Frank Hopkirk, is found stabbed to death at a Jubb's Timber Yard, the site of the new supermarket, by a pair of children. When Barnaby and Jones investigate to determine who wanted Hopkirk dead, they find out that he secretly came to the village under various aliases for sexual rendezvous with various women in fantasy role-playing scenarios, and that he had been making further investigations on the future development site and having doubts over claims it was contaminated. Either someone didn't like his investigations, or someone didn't like his sexual appetite, but either way, Barnaby finds himself investigating lies and more to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and DC Ben Jones (Jason Hughes) find themselves attempting to unravel the deaths of a choir tenor, and later a bird watcher, before more murders occur. The case is complicated by a rivalry between the Midsomer Worthy and Aston Wherry choirs, due to compete in an upcoming competition, and suspicions that an art scam is to be conducted, and soon Barnaby and Jones become concerned about a local woman, who they fear may become a victim herself. Particularly when it becomes clear the bird watcher had been photographing suspicious activity of late.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A few months ago, Annie Woodrow was arrested, accused of murdering her friend, Frances Trevelyan, on the motive of wanting Frances' husband. Her time in court has come, but DCI Barnaby is certain she still is holding things back in regards to the murder, and decides to monitor the trial. Yet a chance remark by Frances' youngest daughter, and a meeting with an old friend and psychiatrist, makes him begin to doubt the evidence for her conviction. Soon he and DC Jones, awaiting news of his promotion to DS, find themselves reinvestigating the case, and it soon becomes clear that they may have missed details that could implicate another in the murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Wellow, someone is killing off the bell ringers of the parish church, in the week before a big bell-ringing competition. One young woman on the team is even shot dead in the churchyard on her wedding day.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Plans by Barnaby to renew his wedding vows at the church of St Michael's in Badger's Drift, are quickly put on hold when the body of Richard Bayly, a local developer, is found decapitated in his own home. The detective is left mystified as to why anyone would kill a man who had only been given weeks to live, after being recently diagnosed with a brain tumour. As he and Troy attempt to find out, they soon encounter a hotbed of corruption and property feuding occurring within the village as the body count rises and the mystery deepens.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Carla Constanza - the face of Brazil's leading cigarette brand for Monarch Tobacco - is found strangled in the infamous Strangler's Wood, Barnaby and Troy not only find themselves investigating her murder, but three identical unsolved murders of innocent girls from eight years before.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Cully's latest boyfriend, Nico, decides to shadow Troy in preparation for a TV role he recently got, but gets more hands-on experience than he expected when investigations into a slashed painting at a museum in Aspern Tallow, a 17th century portrait of Royalist Jonathan Lowrie, are overshadowed by the murder of his descendant, Marcus Lowrie. It isn't long before Barnaby and Troy, with Nico's assistance, find themselves dealing with mysterious, ghostly events, escaped criminals, and a museum trustee who has more to them than meets the eye.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Hector Bridges, a local magistrate, is infuriated when one of his geese is stolen, just as two bands of travellers arrive in Martyr Warren. Although Barnaby and Troy are called in to deal with the theft and later dissuade him from forcefully evicting the travellers from the village, they soon have a murder on their hands, when a short while later Bridges is killed with his own shotgun. It quickly transpires that many in the village had hated the magistrate, who lied, bullied, and committed many an injustice, leaving the detectives determined to find who among them had pulled the trigger after Bridges pushed them past their breaking point.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's Christmas and new detective Charlie Nelson moves into Midsomer. He's thrown straight into an intriguing mystery in the village of Morton Shallows. A man is fatally stabbed with an antique sword during a ghost-hunting party at a "haunted" manor house. Can Barnaby and Nelson find a more earthly motive behind the murder and trap the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of murders in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. As the village prepares for storms and flooding it appears that someone is using ancient torture methods to punish modern-day "sinners". But who is responsible and why?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy farmer Martin Strickland is covered in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads to restaurant Wyvern House and its tyrannical celebrity chef Ruth Cameron. Secrets from the past surface and the killer strikes again - but the poison spreads wider than its intended target.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a body is discovered in a reservoir dropped out of a plane, Barnaby and Nelson find the world of stunt pilots and military heroes hides many dark secrets. Are campaigners against the local airfield behind Bernard King's murder or does it link back to a tragic story from World War Two?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the boss of Calder's Biscuit Company is murdered in Copenhagen, Barnaby and Nelson join forces with two female Danish detectives, the abrasive and astute Poulsen and the charming and cool Degn. They discover Eric Calder had more linking him to Copenhagen than just his famous Golden Clusters.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The ghost village of Little Auburn has been abandoned since the war. When a young man is found murdered during its grand reopening, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter must unravel a sinister web of lies from both past and present in order to catch the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Bleakridge Watch patrols the streets of their remote village, exposing anyone who steps outside the law. When one of their members dies, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter uncover just how far some people will go for power...

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Super Saturday continues full speed ahead as bidders desperately chase the car of their dreams; prices keep rising with the 2018 Ford GT '67 Heritage Edition and the 2018 Ford Bronco VIN001.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: A custom "boater-home" goes under the hammer at no reserve; the auction action intensifies when a 1970 Dodge Challenger HEMI creates a bidding frenzy.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions offers something for everyone, from Mustangs to Camaros, Bentleys to Maseratis, beasts like the Hummer H1 and off-roaders like the Land Cruiser.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Alfa Romeo takes on some of the greatest car and truck manufacturers at the World's Greatest Collector Car Auction, held in Scottsdale Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Bidders see a rise in prices when extraordinary originals and customs make their way across the auction block; Craig Jackson and Steve Davis examine the three 1977 Ford Broncos up for auction and break down the restoration process for each.

programme.desc: Collector cars crossing the block include a C10 truck, a Chevy Camaro, Corvettes, a Toyota Supra and a 1961 Volkswagen 23-window minibus.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Logging country is under siege. Melvin's gung-ho attitude puts the crew in danger. Rygaard's greenhorns fight for a permanent spot on the crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Tempers flare as the logging season hits the rails. Jay Browning battles allergic shock, while Gabe Rygaard sends one of the greenhorns packing.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: As the logging season winds to a close, the drama heats up. Conner fights off defeat, while the men of Pihl fight each other.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: From mountaintop to river's bottom, six crews will take on one of America's deadliest jobs.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: As the summer heats up, so do the men of the mountain. Rygaard breaks in its greenhorns, while Jay Browning takes a gamble on a new yarder operator.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: After an ill-fated road trip, Jimmy and James Smith arrive in Florida to tackle the dangerous black water of the American South, only to realize they're in way over their heads.

programme.desc: The forest fights back as a careless mistake at Browning threatens to take out DJ and Cody. At Rygaard, Gabe gives his greenhorns an ultimatum.

programme.desc: Dave returns from jail but may not have a job to come back to; Shelby hunts his biggest catch of the season.

programme.desc: It's an all-out fight to the finish for Browning and Rygaard, as Gabe mounts a last minute surprise comeback. Shelby vows revenge on the lake log, and at Conner.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee checks out two classic pinball machines; Rick checks out a carrier pigeon capsule from WWII; Rick takes a ribbing when decides to take up boxing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A cast jacket from "Pulp Fiction" arrives in the shop; opera gloves signed by Hollywood legend Clark Gable are brought in; Rick heads to Las Vegas legend Lonnie Hammargren's home to check out his collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A self-portrait from Rolling Stones guitarist Ron Wood finds its way into the shop; Rick becomes nostalgic when a stack of love letters letters handwritten by Mickey Rooney are mailed in.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A medal from British explorer Captain Cook comes into in the shop; Chum checks out a golf putter from the famed 1963 Frank Sinatra Invitational; Chumlee tries to calm Rick down when his stress level hits a new high.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An autograph of baseball legend Honus Wagner; Rick barters for a rare first edition of Nabokov's "Lolita"; Chumlee helps set up the shop's new phone system.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick negotiates for a 1967 Shelby GT350; Corey and Chumlee debate buying one of the first video game consoles; Chumlee asks Rick to test the new ice cream maker.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Colt Army Model 1860 comes into the shop; Rick barters for a Viking coin; Chumlee tries to get a raise using subliminal messages.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick deals for vintage Aerosmith T-shirts; Rick and Corey barter for a U.S. Navy foghorn; Corey checks out a vehicle built to fight off a zombie apocalypse.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed print of Ansel Adams' photograph "Monolith, the Face of Half Dome"; Rick haggles for a 1791 one-cent coin; Corey notices that Rick keeps taking his things.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick haggles for a moonshine still; a collection of 1940s and '50s autographed postcards; Chumlee is making phone calls during work.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An early version of "Rip Van Winkle" enters the shop; Corey and Chum deal for a candle shaped like President Nixon's head; the guys take the Old Man to play shuffleboard.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick inspects a painted bedroom door from the childhood home of music icon Jim Morrison; Chumlee looks at a 1988 Legend of Zelda board game; Corey gets a lead on a rare motorcycle collection.

programme.desc: Bullet shells from John Dillinger's final robbery get caught in the shop; Rick and Corey attempt to make a drive by deal on a vintage Schwinn Whizzer from 1947.

programme.desc: A medal from British explorer Captain Cook comes into in the shop; Chum checks out a golf putter from the famed 1963 Frank Sinatra Invitational; Chumlee tries to calm Rick down when his stress level hits a new high.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny tries to bribe the competition in Canyon Country and becomes more worldly as a result; Ivy and Isaiah make the most of their purchase; Brandi takes on the powers of darkness.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi wakes up on the wrong side of the bed but feels much better after picking up a locker in Placentia; Rene goes to the office to quickly flip his money; Kenny struggles just to get through his unit, which seems to have it in for him.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: It's a hot one in Moreno Valley, with temperatures reaching the 100s; Kenny fights the heat by providing everyone with popsicles; Rene brings along his daughter, Tatiana, who needs a math lesson or two; both of Ivy's sons lend a helping hand.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers try their luck at a new facility in La Habra, where Ivy decides to teach them a lesson; Dusty brews himself up an interesting unit, while Kenny weighs the value of childhood memories when selecting a locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy dons his bright white lucky sneakers in Van Nuys; Brandi and Lisa's friendship is tested as they go head-to-head on a pair of lockers; Kenny sets his fears aside and takes the plunge on a unit that might just immerse him in profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Laura takes the reigns alone in Fullerton and proceeds to outsell Dan; Brandi gets assaulted by her locker but ultimately drives home a winner; Rene postpones a day date in favor of a work date; Darrell stumbles across an unexpected collection.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In the LBC, there are two ways to strike it rich--imports and oil. The buyers dig deep in search of antiques and industrial merchandise. Jarrod and Brandi uncover what appears to be an antique wine rack. Dave Hester and Barry Weiss test each other.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In the college town of Fullerton, California the buyers search for textbooks and rare university artifacts. Dave and Darrell compete in a mano-a-mano showdown.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers roll into the wide open desert in Hemet, California. Barry Weiss tries to kill Dave's "Yups" with kindness. Jarrod and Brandi make their mark on the competition with a tattoo locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are back in Dave Hester's backyard of Newport Beach, CA and they have a visitor. A heavy hitter is on the scene with a story of buying one of the most famous units in storage buying history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are back in Gardena, CA and Dave Hester's rival Nabila Hannis is back as well. Jarrod and Brandi get in the game by grabbing a sportsman's locker. Darrell drops seven grand on a unit full of construction equipment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers negotiate the desert winds of Lancaster, CA. Jarrod arrives cocky, and it's annoying Brandi.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to the northern part of Southern California, Oxnard. Barry Weiss finds a room with a view. Dave Hester's looking for gold, and finds bronze.

programme.desc: The buyers descend upon Tustin, CA. Jarrod and Brandi try to play it smart, but the other bidders make that difficult.
